summary: The Western United States, also known as the American West, is one of the four main regions defined by the U.S. Census Bureau. It includes 13 states, ranging from the Rocky Mountains to the Pacific Coast, and the island state of Hawaii. Historically, the West was considered the area beyond the Appalachian Mountains, and later, the land west of the Mississippi River. The region borders Canada to the north, Mexico to the south, and the Midwest and South in the east. It features diverse landscapes, such as deserts, mountains, forests, and rainforests.
title: Western United States
